project.teaser: The EU Member States should step up their climate change adaptation efforts alongside their intensifying mitigation efforts. Next to and in conjunction with physical and organizational measures, that directly reduce climate change risks, insurance and related risk sharing...
project.objective:
The EU Member States should step up their climate change adaptation efforts alongside their intensifying mitigation efforts. Next to and in conjunction with physical and organizational measures, that directly reduce climate change risks, insurance and related risk sharing solutions have an important role to play. Innovative insurance solutions and risk sharing are crucially needed to incentivize adaptation efforts, in terms of both volume and effectiveness, while also directly contributing to building more resilient societies.
The PIISA project aims to develop and deploy a range of insurance innovations that incite households and firms to adapt proactively and sufficiently for their own sake and their neighborhood’s sake. PIISA also incites public authorities to set up adaptation and create adaptation promoting conditions. PIISA co-develops climate resilient insurance portfolios and develops solutions for sharing losses and climate risk data.
The PIISA project matches scientifically underpinned new insurance concepts with hands-on demonstration of their operability, effectiveness, and acceptability. Extensive user involvement, contextual sensitization, affordability and viability are key features of the new products. The choice of new product developments and sectoral applications will be based on a careful analysis of the adaptation and insurances gaps and their interactions, as well as on deepening product-market feasibility analyses.
PIISA focal sectors are agriculture, forest sector, and cities and citizens’ well-being, involving a host of climate enhanced hazards such as floods, droughts, forest fires, biotic risks, and various types of storms. The consortium counts 12 partners from 5 countries. PIISA involves 3 insurance companies who will actively participate in the insurance pilots conducted in 8 countries, also using their vast multi-million customer base.
project.title: Piloting Innovative Insurance Solutions for Adaptation

result.title: Plan for evaluating barriers and enablers for green roof insurances in the Netherlands
result.description: Plan on how to analyze the enablers and barriers of the green roofs initiative from Interpolis with the objective of drawing generalizable lessons for other EU countries. It is a results of Task 3.2.1.

result.title: Project Data Management Plan (DMP) – Version 1
result.description: Project Data Management Plan a result of Task 5.5

result.title: Review report - Role and potential of insurance in accelerating climate adaptation in Europe
result.description: Analysis of supply and demand of insurance for climate risks, barriers to uptake, design of innovative insurance products, emerging opportunities and policy issues, such as affordability. D1.1 is a result of Task 1.1.

result.title: Project Administration Guide (PAG) – Version 1
result.description: Project Administration Guide as a result of Task 5.2

result.description: Project Risks and Ethics guide is a result of Task 5.3 and Task 5.4

result.title: Project Administration Guide (PAG) – Version 2
result.description: Status report for Mid-Term a result of Task 5.2

result.title: Guidance on setting up Pilots, living documents and coordinated approach for surveying
result.description: Guidance for partners leading and contributing to running. It describes how to set-up a PIISA pilot (including steps, goals, responsibilities, timetable, defining KPIs); description and procedures for using Living documents; and procedures for stakeholder communication with WP4. D3.1 is a result of Task 3.1.

result.title: Report of interactive Mid-Term Webinar
result.description: The report will summarize the mid-term interactive seminar, participants and the discussions and responses from stakeholders during the event. This is a result of Task 4.4.

result.title: Project Data Management Plan (DMP) – Version 2
result.description: Status report for Mid-Term a result of Task 5.5

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Project communication, dissemination and stakeholder engagement plan CDSEP – Version 1
result.description: Project communication, dissemination and stakeholder engagement plan CDSEP – Initial Version. The plan details the overall stakeholder engagement, communication and dissemination strategy, maps stakeholders and identifies target audiences. It specifies actions, follows the WP4 related KPI performance and responsibilities as well as defines key messages, and communication channels.

result.title: Project web site
result.description: The project website is launched. It is a result of Task 4.3.

result.title: Project Management Guide (PMG) – Version 2
result.description: Status report for Mid-Term as a result of Task 5.1

result.title: Preliminary design of the new insurance instrument
result.description: Report describes preliminary design of new insurance product. It is a result of Task 3.4.2

result.title: Potential for agricultural insurance in Boreal region
result.description: Initial assessment of potential for agricultural insurance in Boreal region. Report is a result of Task 3.3.

result.title: Focused market reviews in WP3 pilot sectors/areas
result.description: Market review and analysis of insurance innovation and uptake in pilot regions based on psychometric surveys and interviews of attitudes towards risk, willingness to buy insurance and barriers preventing the insurers to diversify insurance supply. D1.4 is a results of Task 1.1

result.title: Concept of climate change risk sensitized forest insurances
result.description: Report describes preliminary design and modeling framework of new insurance product. It is a result of Task 3.4.1

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
